intro: Gonolobus sagasteguii, commonly known as the Peruvian trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, although it can be invasive in certain regions.
